title: 1924 All-Ireland Senior Football Championship Final
text:
The 1924 All-Ireland Senior Football Championship Final was the 37th All-Ireland Final and the deciding match of the <a href="1924%20All-Ireland%20Senior%20Football%20Championship">1924 All-Ireland Senior Football Championship</a>, an inter-county <a href="Gaelic%20football">Gaelic football</a> tournament for the top teams in <a href="Ireland">Ireland</a>. 
Match.
Summary.
The <a href="Hogan%20Stand">Hogan Stand</a> and a new scoreboard were unveiled at <a href="Croke%20Park">Croke Park</a> for this final. Con Brosnan scored the winning point.
Dublin would not win another All-Ireland football title until <a href="1942%20All-Ireland%20Senior%20Football%20Championship%20Final">1942</a>.
It was the first of three All-Ireland football titles won by Kerry in the 1920s, which made them joint "team of the decade" with Dublin who also won three.
